page.title: 18Mosquitoes In Woodlesford
page.content: Residents of Woodlesford have been complaining about mosquito bites since 1970 when a particulary dangerous species "Aedes Detritus" was found in the area.Many people have suffered every year,last summer was particularly bad and a working party of the Environmental Health Department is investigating the problem.They were breeding on an area of marshy land at Oulton including the site of the Whitbread brewery at Ethaldwell.The first outbreak of mosquitoes caused severe swelling,In one case it was so bad that a man has dug up garden and put concrete paving stones down and installed double glazing.Even the man's relatives won't visit him incase of being bitten by a mosquito. The only way to get rid of them is to pour oil on their eggs.
